com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic
Class Goal

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.Goal
Direct Known Subclasses:
IsolatedGoal
public class Goal
extends java.lang.Object

The class implements the main prolog logic mechanism to solve goals. You must remember that the goal works and return direct values of terms (for speed) so you have to be accurate in work with the values. To avoid risks you can use a IsolatedGoal wrapper.

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)
See Also:
IsolatedGoal, PreparedGoal

Goal

public Goal(java.lang.String goal,
            ProlContext context,
            TraceListener tracer)
     throws java.io.IOException,
            java.lang.InterruptedException
A Constructor

Parameters:
goal - the goal as a String, must not be null
context - the context for the goal, must not be null
tracer - the tracer to listen goal events, can be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if the goal string can't be parsed well
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the process is interrupted

getChainAsList

public java.util.List<Goal> getChainAsList()
Get the current goal chain as a List

Returns:
a List object contains all goals at the goal chain of the root goal

getVarAsNumber

public java.lang.Number getVarAsNumber(java.lang.String varName)
Get the value of a goal variable as a Number object.

Parameters:
varName - the name of the variable, must not be null;
Returns:
null if the variable is not-instantiated one or its value as a Number object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable name is wrong
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value is not-numeric one

getVarAsText

public java.lang.String getVarAsText(java.lang.String varName)
Get the value of a goal variable as a String object.

Parameters:
varName - the name of the variable, must not be null;
Returns:
null if the variable is not-instantiated one or its text representation (like it will be written by the write/1)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable name is wrong

getVarForName

public Var getVarForName(java.lang.String name)
Get a variable goal object for its name

Parameters:
name - the name of the needed variable, must not be null;
Returns:
the found variable as a Var object or null if the variable is not found

Returns:
the generated goal object

solve

public Term solve()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Get next solution of the goal

Returns:
the solution as a term or null if there is not a solution anymore
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the process is interrupted
ProlHaltExecutionException - it will be thrown if the context is halted

Cut the goal chain without reaction of the root chain

isCompleted

public boolean isCompleted()
Check that the goal is completed and doesn't have anymore variants

Returns:
true if the goal is completed else false

getVariableSnapshot

public com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.VariableStateSnapshot getVariableSnapshot()
Get the variable snapshot of the goal

Returns:
the variable snapshot for the goal, it can be null if the goal doesn't have any snapshot
